ed on the grass livid and motionless–
the print of the murderers finger was
on his neck.
He was conveyed home and the
extreme wh misery agony that was
visible in my countenance revealed
the secret to Elizabeth. She was extreme
ly earnest to see the corpse. which for a
long time refused but {?} she persisted,
and entering the room where it lay
quickly hastily examined the neck of
the victim and clasping her hads
hands exclaimed— Go Oh God! I have
murdered this sweet babe. my darling
infant.
She fainted and was retored with
extreme difficulty; and when she again
lived it was only to weep and sigh–
She told me that that same evening
William had teazed her to let him
we we wear a very valuable miniature
she possessed of your Mother. This
picture is gone and was doubtless
the temptation which urged the mur
derer to the deed. We have no trace
of Come my dear Victor him at
present of him, but our exertions are
are unremitted; but they will not restore
my beloved William.
Come, dearest Victor, you alone can
